scope.narrative: The IATI data will cover the not-for-profit side of the organisation (Development Initiatives), Development Initiatives Poverty Research (DIPR). It will cover 100% of the DIPR budget.

publication-timetable.narrative: Full IATI Implementation (covering all projects in the organisation (DIPR and the full IATI Standard) will begin in April 2012 and be completed in April 2013.

publication-frequency.narrative: We will begin by publishing quarterly and 1 quarter in arrears however by the end of 2012 we aim to be able to publish monthly, 1 month in arrears.

data-quality.narrative: The data that we publish will not be audited. Once a year when the accounts are audited we can update the data to verified

approach.narrative: Due to the number of activities that we will report we will use an excel conversion spreadsheet. Programme staff will be responsible for liaising with other colleagues to ensure that the data is published accurately. The lead on IATI reporting is the Finance team. We hope to build a direct report function of our data held in the finance system into the IATI format.

thresholds.narrative: Transaction data will be published by budget line, therefore the data will be aggregated accordingly. We will publish aggregated salary data as a sub-activity

exclusions.narrative: There are no exclusions for publishing activities.

license.narrative: DIPR's finance data will be available for use in the public domain

activity-multilevel.narrative: The organisation is structured with 5 programmes, containing a series of specific projects beneath those. We will report to IATI on 2 activity levels: 1. Top Level - Programmes (including information on full programme budget and descriptions etc.) 2. Lower Level - Corresponding projects that are related to each of the programmes, these will contain more detailed information on financial transactions and specific geographic location (beyond region). These two levels of activities will be related to each other.

segmentation.narrative: Since around only 20 activities are being reported, we are going to report our IATI data in one single file.
